result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:41 PM Defendant CODY A RECORE in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Margaret Marlene Vinz in court for CODY A RECORE. Atty Vinz states the defendant will waive his right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Vinz. Attorney Vinz waives any reading. Atty Vinz enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Atty Vinz goes over request for bond modification. Statement by ADA McElroy, believes the cash bond is appropriate. Court amends to $500 cash and all other conditions remain.

Court adjourned at 1:48 PM
Defendant's
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter to the defendant dated 03/15/2022 re: Court appoints Atty Margaret Vinz. The issue of re-payment will be addressed upon conclusion of the case.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Margaret Vinz)
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Margaret Vinz)
Inmate Request to the Court (denied)

10:12 AM Defendant CODY A RECORE appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def still has not heard back from the public defender's office about an appointment of counsel. Clerk will contact PD's office and will appoint an attorney at the county's expense. Statement by the defendant. Court states a county appointed attorney will be appointed.

Court adjourned at 10:13 AM.
Second appearance on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Inmate Request to the Court
Per Jessica at the PD's office, the defendant qualifies for representation and is looking for a private bar attorney.

9:57 AM Defendant CODY A RECORE appeared in person, in custody, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for the public defender - they are looking at appointing an attorney for the defendant. Statement by the defendant. Court asks staff to contact public defender on defendant's behalf. Status of Counsel Hearing March 10, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:49 AM
Second appearance on February 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:21 AM Defendant CODY A RECORE appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Brad Bollmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes bond has been set. Def requests bond to be lowered. Court denies bond modification. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel and how to obtain one. Court will set for Status of Counsel Feb 08, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:25 AM.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

Defendant Cody Recore appeared in court, Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for Cody Recore, and Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause that a crime may have been committed. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation.
